Great to see the U.S. House Natural Resources Committee pass the ‘Preserving America’s Battlefields Act!’ @RepJodyHice & I introduced this bill to help preserve history and ensure Americans can visit these sites & educate themselves on our great American history for generations.

November is #NationalHealthySkinMonth. As a melanoma survivor, I know that skin health can tell a deeper story than what you see on the surface. Visit  http://skinserious.org  to see how protecting your skin can safeguard your overall health.

I was truly moved when members of our Georgia U.S. House delegation spoke Tuesday on the House floor. I’ve been thankful every day to have the opportunity to work with them and their staff members to help Georgia and our country.

I urge leaders in the House and Senate to quickly resolve their differences so we can move forward with bipartisan appropriations bills, consistent with the terms they agreed to in the ‘Bipartisan Budget Act’ this summer.
Now it’s time to end the political games and ensure veterans, our troops and our national security priorities receive the funding they need to keep America safe.

While 2020 government funding measures have been held up due to partisan obstruction, we passed a measure to support critical government funding for our farmers, national parks, transportation and other areas that make a difference in Americans’ lives:  https://www.isakson.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2019/10/isakson-highlights-georgia-projects-in-senate-passed-federal-funding-measure …
